Reviews.Content: Hotel is OK, staff could do better The room I stayed in on the first floor was very clean but small. The shared toilet and shower rooms were very clean and I did not find myself competing for the facilities with other guests. When I initially attempted to check-in I was informed by the receptionist that I couldn't check-in because she 'was too busy'. Another request to a different receptionist for a plug for the basin in my room was refused. The hotel is OK the staff, however, could be more courteous and helpful.
Reviews.Author: neilatk

Reviews.Content: really really nice room, good location, friendly staff room we stayed in was completely new refurbished. simple but stylish. definatly one of the best hostels we have ever stayed in. shared showers a spacious, new and very very clean!!!!! debbie at the front desk was very helpful. perfect for travellers. laundry facilities, wifi in the hotel. a bargain considering san fran is really expensive! would definatly recommend to stay there.
Reviews.Author: karinkSalzburg

Reviews.Content: Cheap Got a room on the second floor next to the street. It was so noisy the first night (Saturday) sleeping was difficult. Went to the drug store and bought ear plugs the next day, which really helped. If you go, ask for a room away from the main streets. Also, because there are no screens on any of the windows, mosquitoes abound in the hallways. Have to enter/exit the room quickly else the mosquitoes would get into the room. Didn't realize it and got bitten numerous times the first night. Finally had to get up, tracked down, and kill the two mosquitoes in the room. The low flow toilets do not flush well, and we'll leave it at that. The upside are that the room was cheap and clean, and the hotel was next to Chinatown with lots of good cheap places to eat.
Reviews.Author: travelorca

Reviews.Content: Avoid I was very disappointed with the hotel. The staff are RUDE. I have not encounter such rudest people in the world. The hallway is very scary and dark and smelly. Room is small and the surrounding area is noisy. There are lots of homeless people around the area and some could even walk in to the lobby. The facade is always on renovation. I was told by the guard that this is more like an apartment for long term stay than a hotel. The guard also tell me that you better decide to stay or to go somewhere else, afterall we are paying and we should pay for what we like. To stay or not to stay? If you think you cant afford to pay any extra, by all means you stay here. It's a very convenient area but not safe. Not recommend to ladies travellers.
Reviews.Author: DGPS

Reviews.Content: 20 nights in that hotel and i still think it's great Choose that hotel was the best idea i've had. It's so cheap (around 25$ per night), i've got my own room with a good bed, two lights, a fridge, a microwave, a washbasin, a desk, a huge mirror, a big window, a medecinechest, a tv (70channels), a closet, drawers, your own phone... It's not really spacious but, considering the weather, i spend a lot of time in my room and i appreciate it. You can fix the radiator as you want, there is a lot of plugs. It's really clean, each day there are 2 women who change the towels and clean the room (they're so nice that they've ask me when do i prefer they come, and how often). There is a lot of restrooms and bathrooms, always cleans and spacious. When i arrived someone from the staff helped me to carry my luggages. The entire staff was not so nice at the beggining but now they're cool, all the night they've got a security person. Each room has it own mail-box. There is a cheap laundry room in the building. And the place is really cool, it's between the financial area with all the shops, subways/BART and everything, and North Beach, a really nice italian area. The location of the hotel is close to china town, but safe. The only thing is that the people inside are not very friendly but who care, if you need to, go to the club med. And you have to pay the entire price of your stay when you arrive. I don't know about the others rooms, but the third floor is really cool, and i've got the sun each morning by the window (when the weather is cool).
Reviews.Author: French_Jess

Reviews.Content: Best Value in the Area I stayed at the St. Paul twice for 4 nights each period while I was in between apartment leases. Booked another site for the second time, but was unhappy with it and returned to the St. Paul. The hotel is nothing lavish, but certainly met my needs in terms of basic accomodations and value for the money. You will not find a better place (location, private rooms, etc.) in SF. I rarely saw other guests or the resident crazies that you can get in other budget hotels. Hotel: Basic appointments, relatively small but clean rooms, excellently maintained shower and bath areas, microwave, fridge and TV with many channels, wifi and laundry facilities. Renovations are underway with the lobby, restrooms/showers, and some guest rooms completed. Ask about rooms 18, 27, 28 if you would like a more tranquil spot (not facing the street). These rooms have also been updated.Location: In Northbeach, bordering the Financial district. Bus stop right outside and easy walking distance to whatever you need.Staff: Always more than friendly... thanks to Tommy, Pauline, and the rest! Worked to get me a quiet room with good internet access.
Reviews.Author: boileralum

Reviews.Content: was OK I came to SF for a conference and stayed in the hotel for 10 nights. My main priority was to find a cheap hotel near the conference venue and close to the centre. The hotel is probably not the 5* and you most probably won't get Thai massage from the personnel but if you need a place to sleep, to keep your stuff and relax for cheap, then the place is perfect. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. There is a supermarket about 5-10 minutes walk from the place. There is was a microwave in the room so I could warm up my sandwiches etc. The bathrooms are shared. That could be an inconvenience for some, but for this price I am ready to tolerate it.
Reviews.Author: samppa

Reviews.Content: Really wasn't too bad       Top of stairs
Reviews.Author: kford8

Reviews.Content: Avoid This Hotel Folks, beware this is basically a residential hotel complete with the nuts that inhabit such a hotel. I was put in a room next to two boom box bozos who boomed their music all hours of day and night. The staff could not handle them. There was construction work being done in the room above me and next to me. The walls felt as though they would cave in. The staffers a Joe and Patrice are surly, and you just know they hated being in the public. When I asked for an extra blanket they said I had one, although I told them I wanted another one. I was begrudenly given a smoked hole rag for a blanket. I left with fleas. After many many complaints I was finally moved after I asked for the manager. The other room had no view other than all the other windowss off the residents. Forget about getting any sleep at all. Do not waste your money staying here.
Reviews.Author: alicebear

Reviews.Content: Noisy and small, but clean and safe If you're looking for a luxury hotel, you'll need to either pay (a lot) more or stay outside San Francisco. But a room here usually costs just a few dollars more than a dorm bed at the Green Tortoise (hostel) across the street, so it's great if you just want somewhere to rest after a day of sightseeting and a night of partying. (Nothing against Green Tortoise: They're great if you want to meet lots of people.)The location is perfect if you like bars, nightclubs and restaurants: It's right in North Beach, and a few blocks from other attractions such as Chinatown, the Powell Street area and Fisherman's Wharf. It's not so good if you like peace and quiet, as there tend to lots of drunken revellers making lots of noise right until bar closing time (2am), plus noise from traffic.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Welcome to Hotel Hell Simply the rudest, most awful staff I have ever encountered. These people are apparently trained to act more as jail guards than hotel staff. The walls are paper thin, the beds are rock-hard and the rooms are so tiny they are more like cells. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrrrrrribleeee!!! Please don't stay at this hotel. It's the worst experience I've ever been threw.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Want a Third World Experience? Then stay at this hotel!       Hotel on right. And the traffic never stops!!
Reviews.Author: FreeFalling

Reviews.Content: Flophouse Nothing but a dive. There is a bar right under the room we were in and it is near the nightclub scene, so if you want to go to sleep before 3 AM forget it. The shared bathroom/shower will leave you feeling like you need a soak in a vat of disinfectant. This is where homeless people stay when they collect enough cans. I can't fathom how any reputable travel site, like Expedia or Travelocity, could keep this listing in their database. Run for your life from the pimps, drug dealers, and addicts that live here. And don't bother the night staff, they could care less about you.
Reviews.Author: JamesDianaRandy

Reviews.Content: Great value, great location Perfect for the budget traveller looking for a double at 拢125 a week in a vibrant area of san francisco. On the telephone, the helpful receptionist assured me it was not in Chinatown, which might have been awful. Central to all trams, buses, sights, cafes and bars. Glad I did not stay around fisherman's wharf with all the grumper tourists. Book and specify a rear room, take ear plugs, and arrive with few expectations.
Reviews.Author: Simonb10

Reviews.Content: Do not stay here I would not advise anyone to stay at this hotel. I spent 3 nights here and from start to finish it was terrible. There is no lift in this hotel and the receptionist (male) - who is possibly the rudest person I have ever met, watched me struggle to carry my suitcase up 3 flights of stairs without offering any help. The rooms are very basic, not especially clean there was a funny smell off the bed clothes. Every morning we were woken up at 5am with traffic outside (the windows are single glazing) At night time we were almost afraid to walk back into the hotel cause there were drunk bums sitting on the stairs at the entrance to the hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
